page.title: 16Marn'll Book & Methodist Ch.
page.content: The MARN'LL BOOK gives a unique picture of life in the Blackmore Vale. It was produced from material collected by Marnhull Women's Institute to commemorate the Festival of Britain 1951.A copy was presented to Queen Elizabeth the Second at Gillingham in 1952. It describes Marnhull and the Vale in its geographical and historical setting and provides much detail on such things as the churches,schools, local buildings,clubs,societies,field and place names,industries,customs and superstitions. The METHODIST CHURCH was built in 1899 to replace an older one.There are 2 services every Sunday and a midweek meeting.There is a Sunday Club for children and a Holiday Club during the summer holidays.
